Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window

Class Window

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.window.Window
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window.BasicWindow
org.jsfml.graphics.RenderWindow
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics.RenderWindow
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window.Window
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderTarget, WindowStyle
public class Window extends RenderWindow
Provides a window that can serve as a target for 2D drawing. The window is already initialized with an empty scene to which Drawable objects can be added. The game window should not be stored in static fields because after the game restarts, the window is a new object.

  • Method Details

    • setVerticalSyncEnabled

      @Contract("_ -> fail") @Deprecated public void setVerticalSyncEnabled(boolean enable)
      Deprecated.
      Use setFramerateLimit(Window.Framerate.VSYNC) instead.
      Description copied from class: BasicWindow
      Enables or disables vertical synchronization (VSync). Activating vertical synchronization will limit the number of frames displayed to the refresh rate of the monitor. This can avoid some visual artifacts, and limit the framerate to a good value (but not constant across different computers). This should not be used in combination with BasicWindow.setFramerateLimit(int), as these two will conflict with one another. By default, vertical synchronization is disabled.
      Overrides:
      setVerticalSyncEnabled in class BasicWindow
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable vertical synchronization, false to disable

    • getBounds

      @Contract(pure=true) public GlobalRect getBounds()

    • getFramerateLimit

      public int getFramerateLimit()
      Returns:
      the frame rate limit in frames per second (this may be Window.Framerate.UNLIMITED or Window.Framerate.VSYNC)

    • setFramerateLimit

      public void setFramerateLimit(int framerateLimit)
      Sets the maximum frame rate in frames per second. If a limit is set, the window loop will block for a short delay time after flushing the buffer in order to possibly maintain a constant frame rate.
      Activating vertical synchronization is possible by calling this function with the Window.Framerate.VSYNC parameter. This will limit the number of frames displayed to the refresh rate of the monitor, which can avoid some visual artifacts, and limit the framerate to a good value (but not constant across different computers).
      Overrides:
      setFramerateLimit in class BasicWindow
      Parameters:
      framerateLimit - the maximum frame rate in frames per second, Window.Framerate.UNLIMITED to disable the limit, or Window.Framerate.VSYNC for vertical synchronization
